class SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.dict_list_result.DictListResult(matches_dictionaries: List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]])[source]

Bases: Result

This class implements the Result class for lists of dictionaries.

matches_dictionaries

A list of dictionaries representing matches resulting from string search operations.

Type:

List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]]

print(self, n_elements: int = MAX_ITEMS)[source]

Prints the elements in the matches_dictionaries.

__init__(matches_dictionaries: List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]]) → None[source]

Initializes the object with a list of dictionaries representing matches.

Parameters:

matches_dictionaries (List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]]) – A list of dictionaries representing matches resulting from string search operations.

property matches_dictionaries: List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]]

Gets the list of dictionaries if it exists.

Returns:

The list of dictionaries.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Sequence[object]]]

Raises:

AttributeError – If the list of dictionaries does not exist.

print(n_elements: int = 3) → None[source]

Prints the elements in the matches_dictionaries.

If there are only a few dictionaries in the list (up to twice the maximum number of elements specified in the settings), they are printed entirely using pretty print (pprint). Otherwise, the restrict_print_length method is used to output a reduced list.

Parameters:

n_elements (int) – An integer representing the maximum number of elements to print (default value is MAX_ITEMS, which is specified in the NUM category section in the settings file).

restrict_print_length(max_items: int = 3) → None[source]

Restricts the length of printed items to a specified maximum.

If the number of dictionaries exceeds twice the maximum number of items, it prints the first max_items items, followed by an ellipsis, and then the last max_items items.

Parameters:

max_items (int) – The maximum number of elements to print (default value is MAX_ITEMS, which is specified in the NUM category section in the settings file).

SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.result module

result.py

Version 1.0, updated on 2024-12-17

class SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.result.Result[source]

Bases: ABC

Result class.

This class defines a blueprint for results printing functionality, requiring concrete implementations of the ‘print’ and ‘restrict_print_length’ methods.

__init__() → None[source]

Constructor.

Initializes a Result instance.

Since this is an abstract base class, instances cannot be directly created. Subclasses must provide concrete implementations of the abstract methods.

abstract print() → None[source]

Abstract method for printing results.

Subclasses must implement this method to define how results are printed.

abstract restrict_print_length() → None[source]

Restricts the line length of the printed result.

Abstract method that must be implemented by the subclasses.

SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.result.print_mere_results(results: Result) → None[source]

Prints mere results without additional context.

This function simply invokes the print method on the provided Result instance. If the result is None, nothing is printed.

Parameters:

results (Result) – The result object to be printed.

SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.result.print_results(results: Result, title: str = 'Results', descr: object = None) → None[source]

Prints results to console.

  • Prints a title between separating lines and a description, if provided.

  • Prints the results using the print_mere_results function.

  • Prints a separator and a blank line at the end.

Parameters:

  • results (Result) – Object containing results to be printed.

  • title (str) – Optional title for the printed results.

  • descr (object) – Optional description for the printed results.

SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.string_result module

string_result.py

Version 1.0, updated on 2024-12-17

class SentimentAnalysis.src.nlp.results.string_result.StringResult(string: str)[source]

Bases: Result

StringResult class.

This class implements the abstract Result class, managing string results.

string

The string representing the result.

Type:

str

__init__(string: str) → None[source]

Constructor.

Initializes the StringResult class with the provided string.

Parameters:

string (str) – The result string to be managed and printed.

print(n_elements: int = 100)[source]

Prints the result string.

If the string’s length exceeds the specified maximum, the output is restricted to a predefined length.

Parameters:

n_elements (int, optional) – Maximum number of elements to print, default is MAX_STRING_LENGTH, which is set in the settings file.

restrict_print_length() → None[source]

Prints the result string using pretty-print.

This method is called when the string length exceeds the maximum allowed length for direct printing.

property string: str

Retrieves the result string.

Returns:

The managed result string.

Return type:

str
